content.question:
A student must conduct an experiment to verify the conservation of momentum for a closed two-cart system. Cart <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and cart <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> travel toward each other and eventually collide, as shown in the figure. The student has determined the following procedure.

Step 1: Measure the mass of cart <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and cart <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> with a balance.

Step 2: Use a motion sensor to record data of the velocity of each cart before, during, and after the collision.

Step 3: Use the data and <math alttext="the sum of p initial equals the sum of p final" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Σ</mi><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>Σ</mi><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to determine if the right-hand side of the equation is equal to the left-hand side of the equation.

Which of the following steps should the student add to the procedure so that the conservation of momentum can be experimentally verified?

choices.label: Conduct the experiment on a smooth, level surface.
Attach adhesive strips to each cart so that they stick together after they collide.
Ensure that the mass of each cart is the same.
Ensure that the initial speed of each cart is the same.

content.answer: Conduct the experiment on a smooth, level surface.
